image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding up a phone, with an incoming call from a mysterious hooded figure.

props.synopsis: The number of scams reported by Australians has hit a new record high, even though the amount lost has declined.

title.children: Scammers stole $2.7 billion from Australians in 2023, report reveals

image.altText: Smashed windows of a taxi parked on the street.

props.synopsis: Recent incidents of vandalism and violence has shaken Hobart's taxi workforce — and they've had enough. It's an issue the Multicultural Council of Tasmania says needs a 'collective effort' to fix.

title.children: Hobart taxi drivers left 'mentally stressed' and 'not feeling safe' in face of repeated anti-social behaviour

image.altText: Strike it Out founder Kirsten Ritchie

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian charity has spent years and more than $100,000 constructing sleeping pods to be used as crisis accommodation for people experiencing homelessness. But the charity says they're still waiting on council support.

title.children: These 'sleeping pods' could provide accommodation for homeless people, but they're sitting empty

image.altText: A child plays in shallow water on a beach surrounded by other tourists.

props.synopsis: As fans eagerly wait for a new lot of guests to check into the White Lotus, a behind-the-scenes drama has been unfolding to secure the filming location of the Emmy-award winning show.

title.children: Thailand saw an opportunity when White Lotus producers were scouting Asia. Now they're planning to cash in

image.altText: Illustration of two boys running away after stabbing other boy who is on ground bleeding out.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals the failings that helped create one of Queensland's youngest killers.

title.children: Cody was known to child safety since he was a baby. These are the failings that helped make him a killer

image.altText: A young women wearing a red dress sits in front of a grand piano.

props.synopsis: To celebrate the last day of Chinese New Year, Florence Le's family picked her up from the mental health facility she was staying. Two days later, the mother and piano teacher died by suicide inside Sydney's Liverpool Hospital.

title.children: 'Florence didn't want to die': Family speaks after 28yo Sydney woman dies by suicide in hospital

image.altText: MicrosoftTeams-image (30)

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes an impromptu address during a rally against gendered violence in Canberra.

title.children: Albanese tells rally gendered violence is 'a problem of our entire society'

image.altText: A woman performing a squat inside a gym.

props.synopsis: Research finds the knee may have a better ability to heal than previously thought, and suggests that some patients may be better off without surgery.

title.children: Can you heal an ACL tear without surgery? A new Australian study says yes, but not all surgeons are convinced

image.altText: A man with thinning white hair and white beard waives with his right hand

props.synopsis: As the biggest election in the world begins, academics and activists abroad have been barred from entering India after speaking out against Narendra Modi and policies of his government.

title.children: 'Classic authoritarian': Modi government denies entry to 'overseas citizens'

image.altText: An old photo of a young girl with her face blurred

props.synopsis: The fundamentalist sect is known by a variety of names including the Two by Twos, The Church With No Name, The Truth and The Way, and has about 8,000 followers across Australia.

title.children: FBI investigating secretive Christian sect with Australian followers for historical child sex abuse

image.altText: a rainbow flag being lowered into a fire on the floor by two people among a crowd

props.synopsis: Rights groups say it is a "serious blow to fundamental human rights" that Iraq passed new laws which sentence people who engage in same-sex relations to up to 15 years in prison.

title.children: 'Attack on human rights': Iraq criminalises same-sex relationships with threats of up to 15 years in prison

image.altText: A compsoite image of two detained Russian journalists.

props.synopsis: Two Russian journalists have been arrested and charged over accusations they worked for a group founded by late Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny.

title.children: Two Russian journalists on 'extremism' charges over alleged work for Navalny group

image.altText: A golden pocket watch.

props.synopsis: A golden watch belonging to the Titanic's richest passenger and a violin bag belonging to the bandmaster have gone under the hammer in England.

title.children: Watch belonging to Titanic's richest passenger sells for record sum

image.altText: Nicole Kidman arrives on the red carpet for the American Film Institute Lifetime Achievement Awards.  in a gold sparkly dress

props.synopsis: The Oscar winner and five-time Academy Award nominee joins previous recipients such as Meryl Streep, Julie Andrews, Al Pacino and George Clooney.

title.children: Nicole Kidman becomes first Aussie to be celebrated for lifetime achievements by AFI

image.altText: A collage of front pages of the National Enquirer with headlines like 'How Trump Will Win!' and 'Hillary and Huma Going to Jail'

props.synopsis: In a bleak Manhattan court, the evidence has centred on the National Enquirer — a gossip rag with a history of specialising in chequebook scoops, true crime, celebrity scuttlebutt and pumping up Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Healthiest individual ever elected!': Trump, the tabloid and the plan to win him the White House

image.altText: A composite images positions an image of Jacinda Ardern giving a speech next to Elon Musk standing behind an X logo

props.synopsis: The organisation set up to work with governments and technology companies to eradicate violent content online in the wake of the Christchurch attacks confirms it has offered assistance to Australia over its legal battle with X.

title.children: After the Christchurch attacks, Twitter made a deal with Jacinda Ardern. Elon Musk changed everything

image.altText: Grant Champion, Tom Auriac and Tony Jackson at Stonehenge Hotel in Western Queensland.

props.synopsis: Two young mates now own a western Queensland pub outright through a deal built of mutual trust they say should be more common.

title.children: Gen Z publicans pay off remote pub with 'country way' loan from former owner

image.altText: A small orange bat looks directly at the camera

props.synopsis: A bat ecologist says negative stereotypes and links to the COVID-19 outbreak have given bats a poor reputation, yet they play an important role in controlling insects, pollinating plants and spreading seeds.

title.children: Bats have a negative reputation, but do they deserve such a bad rap?

image.altText: A motorbike involved in a fatal crash.

props.synopsis: A motorcyclist has died on a WA road every week on average this year with the majority of them men in their 40s and older.

title.children: Older riders considering getting on a motorbike urged to 'think about the risk'

image.altText: Isaac Heeney is congratulated after kicking a Sydney Swans AFL goal.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans thump Hawthorn by 76 points to record their sixth win of the season, following Gold Coast's victory over West Coast at Carrara.

title.children: Classy Swans win big over Hawks at MCG, Suns down the Eagles

image.altText: A woman in a black blazer stands in front of a lawn looking concerned, another younger woman behind her also with furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: Co-creator and lead actor Robyn Malcolm untangles the forces at play underneath what's been called New Zealand's best television show.

title.children: This Kiwi drama divided New Zealand, and now it's our time to ask: What happened at the party?

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Don't be shy now. You think you know it all? Prove it.

title.children: Fancy yourself somewhat of a quiz connoisseur? I'll believe it when I see it. Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: A composite image of apartment blocks next to a birds eye view of a suburb with homes and gardens

props.synopsis: The YIMBY movement argues fewer development restrictions and more construction will lower property prices. But two decades of intense densification across Australia's cities suggest it may not be the cure-all they hope for.

title.children: Is YIMBYism the answer to Australia's housing affordability woes?

image.altText: Woman cooking  in a kitchen

props.synopsis: With consumers paying more for extra virgin olive oil at the supermarket, chef Kirsten Bacon shares her favourite alternatives that won't break the bank.

title.children: The price of olive oil has skyrocketed. Here's what a chef says you can use instead

image.altText: A photo of Saxon Mullins, who is wearing brown and pink curly hair and a navy top, looking seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: It's been more than a decade since Saxon Mullins accused a man of raping her behind his father's nightclub in Kings Cross. Since then she's learned a lot about endurance — and the life-saving power of pop music.

title.children: After a gruelling, traumatic sexual assault trial, Saxon Mullins says a pop song saved her life

image.altText: Oleksandra leans again a brick wall and smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: What's it like to flee your homeland? Siobhan Marin and a group of school students find out on a simulated refugee journey in Western Sydney. It's led by tour guides who've made the dangerous trip themselves.

title.children: Oleksandra trained as a psychologist, but she carries another title that still carries stigma

image.altText: Rugby league coach Ricky Stuart, in a white polo shirt, looking concerned during a match

props.synopsis: Ricky Stuart's 500th NRL match as coach ends on a sour note, with the Cronulla Sharks thumping his Canberra Raiders 40-0.

title.children: Ricky's Raiders flogged 40-0 in coach's 500th NRL match as Cronulla move to top of ladder

image.altText: A sign that says Rockingham General Hospital

props.synopsis: WA Homicide Squad detectives charge a man with murder after he allegedly assaulted the woman he lived with and set fire to their home in Perth's south.

title.children: Man charged with murder after Perth woman allegedly assaulted, left in burning house

image.altText: Plaque of fallen soldier with poppies and rosemary

props.synopsis: Caretakers of a Hobart war memorial are looking beyond aesthetics in their management practices to preserve species that may have otherwise died out.

title.children: Untouched by development, this soldiers' memorial in Tasmania is giving rare and vulnerable treasures a chance to thrive

image.altText: Black and white photo of four different band members who are young Indonesian women holding guitars and a drum

props.synopsis: Indonesia is one of Australia's closest neighbouring countries, and yet how much is really known about its intricate past? Some of those gaps are being filled through the rediscovery of old music records.

title.children: The gold-smuggling Indonesian pilot who produced one of the country's most provocative girl bands

image.altText: John Cecchi preparing for a dive off the Perth coast

props.synopsis: A Perth archaeologist and anthropologist has made an unexpected discovery — some of the known shipwrecks off the WA coast aren't where they're supposed to be.

title.children: Search for known shipwrecks off WA coast finds some just aren't where they're supposed to be

image.altText: An Indigenous man playing the didgeridoo in the foreground, smoking ceremony in the background

props.synopsis: First Nations groups hold about 40 per cent of Australian land through native title claims, yet own and control less than 0.2 per cent of the country's water.

title.children: 'We're being dispossessed as we sit here': First Nations truth-telling lays bare fight for water rights

image.altText: A woman sits on a bench near the ocean with her daughter in her lap

props.synopsis: Residents of bushfire- and flood-affected communities travel to support applicants of a landmark climate case. Torres Strait Islanders Uncle Paul Kabai and Uncle Pabai Pabai are suing the Commonwealth for "failing its duty of care" to protect their homelands from climate change.

title.children: Uncle Paul doesn't want to see his home underwater. He's taking the federal government to court

image.altText: a massive rubble of a house is behind two little girls crouching and talking

props.synopsis: Hamas is reviewing Israel's latest ceasefire proposal as it releases video of two Israeli hostages.

title.children: Hamas releases video of two male hostages taken on October 7 from Israel

image.altText: A woman conducts a choir or brightly coloured performers, outside under a tree

props.synopsis: Scientists have been singing the praises of community choirs for decades, and they're only just scratching the surface on all of the benefits for cognitive, social and emotional wellbeing. So what is it about coming together in song that feels so magical?

title.children: The neuroscience of singing: How choirs help our brains and bodies recover from burnout
